body: The problem is that these values can be tweaked until eternity, no two people with different OS / configuration are going to arrive at exactly the same value.
Haven't tested it yet but I think just a `this->adjustSize()` would do the job better

@emilengler 

> Haven't tested it yet but I think just a `this->adjustSize()` would do the job better

IMO, [QWidget::adjustSize()](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qwidget.html#adjustSize) should not be used to fix a broken layout.

It first was introduced in our repo in #16971, but I agree with @promag's https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16971#issuecomment-535672268 and @Sjors's https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16971#issuecomment-536469659.

@laanwj @jonasschnelli @emilengler 
Thank you for your reviews.

> Wasn't there some other way to pack the window?

Yes, alternative `QGridLayout` layout is used in the latest push.

> We should really try to avoid relying on hardcoded heights. The necessary heght varies based on things such as font size, DPI, styling.

All number in `forms/receiverequestdialog.ui` are just Qt Designer artefacts.
